alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Louisa; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 2:22PM CDT until March 31 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ROCK ISLAND...NORTHWESTERN MERCER...NORTHWESTERN DES MOINES...LOUISA AND MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 222 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Morning Sun, or 8 miles southwest of Wapello, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Wapello and Toolesboro around 230 PM CDT. Grandview, Flaming Prairie Park and Snively Access Campground around 235 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Fruitland, Eliza, Letts, Muscatine Municipal Airport, Sand Springs, Ardon, Muscatine, Fairport, Illinois City, Fairport Recreation Area, New Era, Wildcat Den State Park and Shady Creek Campground. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Iowa. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
